snippet: Dispatching the personal representative of its paramount leader to Damascus, Iran moved to reframe the conflict as part of a battle with the United States and others.
abstract: Iran moves to reframe the Syrian conflict as part of a wider battle with the United States and other hostile world powers, dispatching Saeed Jalili, the personal representative of its paramount leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, to Damascus for a televised display of solidarity with Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad; visit underscores Iran's increasingly dogmatic view of the conflict.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by an employee of The New York Times in Aleppo, Syria; Dalal Mawad and Hwaida Saad from Beirut; Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran; Lydia Polgreen from Johannesburg; Steven Lee Myers from Washington; and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Dispatching the personal representative of its paramount leader to Damascus, Iran moved to reframe the conflict as part of a battle with the United States and others.

headline.seo: Envoy to Assad Warns World of Iran’s Stakes in Syria
headline.main: Iran Envoy Casts Syria as Part of Wider Conflict
headline.print_headline: Iran Envoy Casts Syria as Part of Wider Conflict
